Item 1.01 - Entry into a Material Defini.content: On May 6, 2025, DoorDash, Inc. (“DoorDash” or the “Company”) issued an announcement (the “Rule 2.7 Announcement”) pursuant to Rule 2.7 of the UK City Code on Takeovers and Mergers (the “Code”), disclosing that the board of directors of the Company and the board of directors of Deliveroo plc (“Deliveroo”) had reached agreement on the terms of a recommended final cash offer by the Company for the entire issued and to be issued share capital of Deliveroo (the “Transaction”). In connection with the Transaction, the Company and Deliveroo entered into a Co-operation Agreement, a Bridge Term Loan Credit and Guaranty Agreement, and an Escrow Agreement.

subsections.Rule 2.7 Announcement: On May 6, 2025, the Company issued the Rule 2.7 Announcement disclosing the agreement on the terms of the Transaction. The Transaction will be implemented via a court-sanctioned scheme of arrangement. Deliveroo shareholders will receive 180 pence in cash for each share. The Transaction is subject to conditions including: (i) approval by a majority of Deliveroo shareholders representing at least 75% in value; (ii) sanction by the High Court of Justice in England and Wales; (iii) the Scheme becoming effective by the Long-Stop Date of May 6, 2026; and (iv) receipt of regulatory approvals. The Transaction is expected to be completed in the fourth calendar quarter of 2025. The Company may elect to implement the Transaction via a Takeover Offer, subject to certain consents and terms. The financial terms are final unless a third-party offer for Deliveroo is announced.
subsections.Co-operation Agreement: On May 6, 2025, the Company and Deliveroo entered into a Co-operation Agreement. They agreed to use all reasonable endeavors to obtain required regulatory authorizations and to cooperate in preparing offering documents and other matters. The agreement also contains provisions regarding employee-related matters and Deliveroo’s employee equity plans.
subsections.Irrevocable Undertakings: On May 5 and May 6, 2025, Greenoaks Capital Opportunities Fund, L.P. and DST Managers V Limited, respectively, delivered Shareholder Undertakings to vote their shares in favor of the Scheme. These represent approximately 8.967% of Deliveroo’s outstanding shares. Additionally, on May 6, 2025, each member of the Deliveroo Board holding shares delivered Director Undertakings to vote their shares in favor of the Scheme, representing approximately 6.462% of Deliveroo's outstanding shares. These undertakings will remain in effect if the transaction is effected by a Takeover Offer and will cease under certain circumstances.
subsections.Bridge Credit Agreement: The information set forth in Item 2.03 regarding the Bridge Credit Agreement is incorporated by reference into this Item 1.01.
subsections.Escrow Agreement: The Company entered into an Escrow Agreement with JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., as escrow agent, and J.P. Morgan Securities plc. The Company deposited cash in escrow to partially fund the cash consideration for the Transaction and to satisfy UK Code requirements for certainty of funding. These funds may be converted from USD to GBP via a deal-contingent foreign exchange forward transaction.

Item 2.03 - Creation of a Direct Financi.content: Pursuant to the Bridge Credit Agreement dated May 6, 2025, lenders agreed to provide the Company with borrowings up to an aggregate amount of $2.85 billion to, among other things, partially finance the cash consideration for the Transaction with Deliveroo. The Company's obligations are guaranteed by certain of its domestic subsidiaries.

subsections.Purpose and Funding: The lenders agreed to provide up to $2.85 billion to partially finance the cash consideration for the Transaction. This amount may be converted into GBP via a deal-contingent foreign exchange forward transaction.
subsections.Draw-down Conditions: From the signing date until the Long-Stop Date or other customary draw-stop triggers, lenders cannot cancel commitments, terminate the agreement, or refuse to make a loan if it would prevent or limit the funding on the closing date of the Transaction, consistent with UK Code requirements.
subsections.Maturity and Interest: Loans will mature 364 days after the closing date of the Transaction. Interest will be, at the Company's option, at a per annum rate equal to (i) the base rate plus a spread of 0.625% or 0.750% or (ii) an adjusted term SOFR plus a spread of 1.625% or 1.750%. The spread is determined by the Company's senior, unsecured debt ratings.
subsections.Fees: The Company is obligated to pay customary administration fees, syndication fees, commitment fees, ticking fees, and duration fees for a credit facility of this size and type.
subsections.Covenants and Guarantees: The Bridge Credit Agreement contains customary representations and warranties, events of default, and affirmative and negative covenants. The Company’s obligations are guaranteed by certain of its domestic subsidiaries meeting specified materiality thresholds.

Item 7.01 - Regulation FD Disclosure.content: On May 6, 2025, the Company issued a press release announcing the Transaction. A copy of the press release is furnished as Exhibit 99.1. The information furnished pursuant to Item 7.01, including Exhibit 99.1, shall not be deemed to be “filed” for purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, shall not otherwise be subject to the liabilities of that section and shall not be deemed incorporated by reference in any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, unless specifically identified therein as being incorporated therein by reference.

Item 9.01 - Financial Statements and Exh.content: This section includes exhibits filed with this report and important informational statements regarding the nature of this filing and forward-looking statements.

2.5 - Deed of Irrevocable Undertaking, dated as of May 6, 2025, by and between the Company and DST Managers V Limited

subsections.Further Information; No Offer or Solicit: This Form 8-K is for information purposes only and is not an offer to sell or a solicitation of an offer to purchase any securities. The Transaction will be implemented solely through the Scheme document (or Takeover Offer document), which will contain the full terms and conditions. Deliveroo shareholders are advised to read the formal documentation once it is despatched.
subsections.Cautionary Statement Concerning Forward-: This Form 8-K contains forward-looking statements regarding the Transaction, future financial performance, business strategies, and other matters. These statements involve known and unknown risks and uncertainties, and actual results may differ materially. Factors include the ability to complete the Transaction, obtain necessary approvals, changes in economic and market conditions, and other risks described in the Company's SEC filings. The Company assumes no obligation to update these statements except as legally required.
